conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces per wall are visible, and the camera is angled with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with readable wall corners and floor plane separation; cutaway is clean and interior volume is apparent. Minor simplifications in geometry/openings reduce full credit.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall footprint/rectangular massing is loosely similar, but the plan fidelity is weak: bedroom count appears increased (3 beds/rooms shown vs 2 bedrooms in plan), several labeled spaces from the 2D plan are not represented distinctly (garage, balcony, laundry/robe/linen/entry), and internal partitions/adjacencies do not convincingly match the 2D layout.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (beds, dining table, some kitchen/bath elements), but room assignment is unreliable due to layout mismatch and some key service areas are missing/merged.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors are distinguishable and lighting is adequate, but geometry is somewhat soft/blurred and text labels appear on the floor, reducing presentation cleanliness.

detected_errors.description: Major spaces from the 2D plan are missing or not modeled as separate areas (notably the garage and balcony; service zones like laundry/robe/linen/entry are not clearly present).
Layout fidelity issues: room count/proportions and internal partition placement do not match the 2D plan (appears to introduce an extra bedroom/bedroom-like space and alters adjacencies).
Doors/windows/openings are simplified and not verifiably placed on the same walls as in the 2D plan.
Text labels are visible on the 3D floor surfaces, reducing clean presentation scoring.

summary: A genuine 3D cutaway was produced, but the resulting model deviates substantially from the 2D plan’s room count and key space layout, limiting geometric fidelity.
